title: Public Employees' Retirement System: service credit.
subject: PublicEmployees'RetirementSystem
servicecredit

abstracts.abstract:
The Public Employees' Retirement Law (PERL) creates the Public Employees' Retirement System (PERS) , which provides a defined benefit to its members based on age at retirement, service credit, and final compensation, and prescribes the rate of employer contributions to PERS. PERL requires time during which a member is excused from performance of their duties and for which they receive compensation in an amount less than full compensation to be credited as service, as specified.

This bill would make nonsubstantive changes to that provision.

actions.description: From printer. May be heard in committee March 21.

extras.impact_clause: An act to amend Section 21008 of the Government Code, relating to public employees' retirement.
